alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Mathews (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 1:04AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN GLOUCESTER AND MATHEWS COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 103 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hayes, or near Gloucester Courthouse, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gloucester Courthouse and Hayes around 110 AM EDT. Mobjack around 125 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ruff, Beulah, Moon, Laban, Glass, Naxera, Fort Nonsense, Clay Bank, North, and Soles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
